meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to experience severe emotional shock and distress.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise traumatises the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The car accident traumatises the driver.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie traumatises the character, but the audience finds it thrilling.
meanings.sent4: The sudden loss of a loved one traumatises the heart like a deep wound.
meanings.sent5: The war scene in the movie traumatises the viewers with its realism.

meanings.sent1: She traumatises easily after watching scary movies.
meanings.sent2: He traumatises whenever he recalls the accident.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear traumatises the child when it mysteriously moves on its own.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph traumatises her, bringing back painful memories.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house traumatises visitors with its eerie atmosphere.
